intro: Pyrostria amporoforensis, commonly known as the Madagascar star fern, is a unique member of the Blechnaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped fronds that give it a distinctive appearance. Native to Madagascar, this plant thrives in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread slowly across forest floors. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
